pkgmetadata.longdescription:
RPCemu (an acronym for "RiscPC" emulator) is an open-source, low-level Acorn RiscPC/A7000 emulator developed for Windows and Linux originally by Sarah Walker.
The RiscPC was the penultimate Acorn desktop computer based around the ARM CPU architecture (which Sophie Wilson and Steve Furber invented at Acorn in 1983-1984). It was compatible with processors from the ARM610 to the SA110 StrongARM from DEC. It was followed by the less upgradable entry-level 32 MHz ARM7500(FE) system-on-a-chip based A7000(+).
There is also emulation of the RiscPC2 (codename Pheobe) which was terminated shortly before going to market as Acorn began to be asset striped before liquidation.
